007package renderer.models_TP;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker_TP;
012import renderer.scene.util.MeshType;
013
014/**
015   Create a solid model of a frustum of a right square pyramid
016   with its base in the xz-plane.
017<p>
018   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frustum" target="_top">
019                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frustum</a>
020
021   @see Pyramid
022*/
023public class PyramidFrustum extends Model implements MeshMaker_TP
024{
025   public final double s1;
026   public final double s2;
027   public final double h;
028   public final int n;
029   public final int k;
030   public final MeshType type;
031
032   /**
033      Create a frustum of a right square pyramid with its base in the
034      xz-plane, a base side length of 2, top side length of 1, and height 1/2.
035   */
036   public PyramidFrustum( )
037   {
038      this(2.0, 1.0, 0.5, 7, 4);
039   }
040
041
042   /**
043      Create a frustum of a right square pyramid with its base in the
044      xz-plane, a base side length of {@code s1}, top side length of
045      {@code s2}, and height {@code h}.
046   <p>
047      This model works with either {@code s1 > s2} or {@code s1 < s2}.
048      In other words, the frustum can have its "apex" either above or
049      below the xz-plane.
050
051      @param s1  side length of the base of the frustum
052      @param s2  side length of the top of the frustum
053      @param h   height of the frustum
054   */
055   public PyramidFrustum(final double s1, final double s2, final double h)
056   {
057      super(String.format("Pyramid Frustum(%.2f,%.2f,%.2f)", s1, s2, h));
058
059      this.s1 = s1;
060      this.s2 = s2;
061      this.h = h;
062      this.n = 1;
063      this.k = 1;
064      this.type = MeshType.HORIZONTAL;
065
066      // Create the frustum's geometry.
067      addVertex(new Vertex(-s1/2, 0, -s1/2),  // base
068                new Vertex(-s1/2, 0,  s1/2),
069                new Vertex( s1/2, 0,  s1/2),
070                new Vertex( s1/2, 0, -s1/2),
071                new Vertex(-s2/2, h, -s2/2),  // top
072                new Vertex(-s2/2, h,  s2/2),
073                new Vertex( s2/2, h,  s2/2),
074                new Vertex( s2/2, h, -s2/2));
075
076      // Create 12 triangles.
077      addPrimitive(new TriangleStrip(0, 3, 1, 2),  // 2 base triangles
078                   new TriangleStrip(4, 0, 5, 1, 6, 2, 7, 3, 4, 0),
079                   new TriangleStrip(4, 5, 7, 6)); // 2 top triangles
080   }
081
082
083   /**
084      Create a frustum of a right square pyramid with its base in the
085      xz-plane, a base side length of {@code s}, top of the frustum at
086      height {@code h}, and with the pyramid's apex at on the y-axis at
087      height {@code a}.
088
089      @param n  number of lines of latitude
090      @param k  number of lines of longitude
091      @param s  side length of the base of the frustum
092      @param h  height of the frustum
093      @param a  height of the apex of the pyramid
094      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 0
095      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 1
096   */
097   public PyramidFrustum(final int n, final int k,
098                         final double s, final double h, final double a)
099   {
100      this(s, (1 - h/a)*s, h, n, k);
101   }
102
103
104   /**
105      Create a frustum of a right square pyramid with its base in the
106      xz-plane, a base side length of {@code s}, top of the frustum at
107      height {@code h}, and with the pyramid's apex at on the y-axis at
108      height {@code a}.
109
110      @param n  number of lines of latitude
111      @param k  number of lines of longitude
112      @param s  side length of the base of the frustum
113      @param h  height of the frustum
114      @param a  height of the apex of the pyramid
115      @param type  choose between striped and checkerboard triangle strips
116      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 0
117      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 1
118   */
119   public PyramidFrustum(final int n, final int k,
120                         final double s, final double h, final double a,
121                         final MeshType type)
122   {
123      this(s, (1 - h/a)*s, h, n, k, type);
124   }
125
126
127   /**
128      Create a frustum of a right square pyramid with its base in the
129      xz-plane, a base side length of {@code s1}, top side length of
130      {@code s2}, and height {@code h}.
131   <p>
132      This model works with either {@code s1 > s2} or {@code s1 < s2}.
133      In other words, the frustum can have its "apex" either above or
134      below the xz-plane.
135
136      @param s1  side length of the base of the frustum
137      @param s2  side length of the top of the frustum
138      @param h   height of the frustum
139      @param n   number of lines of latitude
140      @param k   number of lines of longitude
141      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 0
142      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 1
143   */
144   public PyramidFrustum(double s1, double s2, double h,
145                         final int n, final int k)
146   {
147      this(s1, s2, h, n, k, MeshType.HORIZONTAL);
148   }
149
150
151   /**
152      Create a frustum of a right square pyramid with its base in the
153      xz-plane, a base side length of {@code s1}, top side length of
154      {@code s2}, and height {@code h}.
155   <p>
156      This model works with either {@code s1 > s2} or {@code s1 < s2}.
157      In other words, the frustum can have its "apex" either above or
158      below the xz-plane.
159
160      @param s1  side length of the base of the frustum
161      @param s2  side length of the top of the frustum
162      @param h   height of the frustum
163      @param n   number of lines of latitude
164      @param k   number of lines of longitude
165      @param type  choose between striped and checkerboard triangle strips
166      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 0
167      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 1
168   */
169   public PyramidFrustum(double s1, double s2, double h,
170                         final int n, final int k,
171                         final MeshType type)
172   {
173      super(String.format("Pyramid Frustum(%.2f,%.2f,%.2f,%d,%d)",
174                                           s1,  s2,  h,   n, k));
175
176      if (n < 0)
177         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n must be greater than or equal to 0");
178      if (k < 1)
179         throw new IllegalArgumentException("k must be greater than 0");
180
181      this.s1 = s1;
182      this.s2 = s2;
183      this.h = h;
184      this.n = n;
185      this.k = k;
186      this.type = type;
187
188      // Create the pyramid's geometry.
189      final double deltaH = h / (n - 1);
190
191      // An array of vertices to be used to create faces.
192      final Vertex[][] v = new Vertex[n][4*k + 1];
193
194      // Create all the vertices.
195      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) // choose a height of latitude
196      {
197         final double y = i * deltaH;
198         final double slantSide = s1 - i*((s1 - s2) / (n - 1));
199         final double deltaS = slantSide / k;
200
201         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
202         {
203            v[i][j] = new Vertex(-slantSide/2 + j*deltaS,
204                                  y,
205                                 -slantSide/2);
206         }
207         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
208         {
209            v[i][k+j] = new Vertex( slantSide/2,
210                                    y,
211                                   -slantSide/2 + j*deltaS);
212         }
213         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
214         {
215            v[i][2*k+j] = new Vertex( slantSide/2 - j*deltaS,
216                                      y,
217                                      slantSide/2);
218         }
219         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
220         {
221            v[i][3*k+j] = new Vertex(-slantSide/2,
222                                     y,
223                                     slantSide/2 - j*deltaS);
224         }
225         // create one more vertex to close the latitude
226         v[i][4*k] = new Vertex(v[i][0].x, v[i][0].y, v[i][0].z);
227      }
228
229      // Add all of the vertices to this model.
230      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
231      {
232         for (int j = 0; j < 4*k + 1; ++j)
233         {
234            addVertex( v[i][j] );
235         }
236      }
237      addVertex(new Vertex(0, h, 0),
238                new Vertex(0, 0, 0));
239      final int topCenterIndex = n * (4*k + 1),
240                bottomCenterIndex = topCenterIndex + 1;
241
242      // Create all the square strips around the pyramid wall.
243      if (MeshType.HORIZONTAL == type)
244      {
245         for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i) // choose a height of latitude
246         {
247            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
248            for (int j = 0; j < 4*k + 1; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
249            {
250               triStrip.addIndex(    i*(4*k+1)+j); // v[i  ][j]
251               triStrip.addIndex((i+1)*(4*k+1)+j); // v[i+1][j]
252            }
253            addPrimitive(triStrip);
254         }
255      }
256      else if (MeshType.VERTICAL == type)
257      {
258         for (int j = 0; j < 4*k; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
259         {
260            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
261            triStrip.addIndex(bottomCenterIndex);
262            for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) // choose a height of latitude
263            {
264               triStrip.addIndex(i * (4*k+1) + j);    // v[i][j  ]
265               triStrip.addIndex(i * (4*k+1) + j+1);  // v[i][j+1]
266            }
267            triStrip.addIndex(topCenterIndex);
268            addPrimitive(triStrip);
269         }
270      }
271      else // MeshType.CHECKER triangle strips
272      {
273         for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i) // choose a height of latitude
274         {
275            for (int j = 0; j < 4*k; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
276            {
277               addPrimitive(
278                  new TriangleStrip(
279                         i*(4*k+1)+j,     // v[i  ][j  ]
280                     (i+1)*(4*k+1)+j,     // v[i+1][j  ]
281                         i*(4*k+1)+j+1,   // v[i  ][j+1]
282                     (i+1)*(4*k+1)+j+1)); // v[i+1][j+1]
283            }
284         }
285      }
286
287      if ( MeshType.HORIZONTAL == type
288        || MeshType.CHECKER == type )
289      {
290         // Create the triangle fan in the top.
291         final Primitive topFan = new TriangleFan();
292         topFan.addIndex(topCenterIndex);
293         for (int j = 4*k; j >= 0; --j) // choose a line of longitude
294         {
295            topFan.addIndex( (n-1)*(4*k+1)+j ); // v[n-1][j]
296         }
297         addPrimitive(topFan);
298
299         // Create the triangle fan in the base.
300         final Primitive botFan = new TriangleFan();
301         botFan.addIndex(bottomCenterIndex);
302         for (int j = 0; j < 4*k + 1; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
303         {
304            botFan.addIndex( j );  // v[0][j]
305         }
306         addPrimitive(botFan);
307      }
308   }
309
310
311
312   // Implement the MeshMaker_TP interface (four methods).
313   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return n;}
314
315   @Override public int getVertCount() {return k;}
316
317   @Override public MeshType getType() {return type;}
318
319   @Override
320   public PyramidFrustum remake(final int n, final int k, final MeshType type)
321   {
322      return new PyramidFrustum(this.s1, this.s2,
323                                this.h,
324                                n, k,
325                                type);
326   }
327}//PyramidFrustum
